Text.Value: We won't honey. We'll get her a coffin, I promise.

EditorData.NodeContext: a little hestitant, knows this is a promise she can't keep, but trying to be strong for her husband

Text.Value: I am not leaving until Lily has a godsdamned coffin.

EditorData.NodeContext: yelling, upset

Text.Value: Why is this happening? Why our baby girl?

EditorData.NodeContext: doesn't even see player - heart broken and grieving

Text.Value: You did? You hear that, honey?

EditorData.NodeContext: overwhelming relief

Text.Value: If you're here for a burial, good luck. The carpenter round back claims there's a 'backlog'. We asked for a child-sized coffin, but he said it'll take a month.

EditorData.NodeContext: sees player.

Text.Value: I won't bury Lily without a coffin, I refuse.

EditorData.NodeContext: still upset but more frustrated now than his previous lines

Text.Value: I know, love. I know.

EditorData.NodeContext: heartbroken but trying to keep it together for her husband

Text.Value: Oh, there's a 'priority' fee, but not all of us have the barrels of gold to spare. Arsehole.

EditorData.NodeContext: disgusted

Text.Value: Your daughter's coffin will be ready soon. I took care of it.
I am not dumping my seven-year-old in a hole.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset, grieving, furious

Text.Value: The carpenter is making you one now. Don't ask questions.
I'm sorry, but our baby girl... our baby...

EditorData.NodeContext: realised he's snapped at his wife - apologetic but also just flooded with grief

Text.Value: So instead I'll say this - Lily was our world. Knowing that she'll be able to put to rest properly makes things... easier. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: first time we see her a bit upset, overwhelmed with gratitude

Text.Value: Leave.
No one's suggesting that. We've just gotta... figure this out.

EditorData.NodeContext: a little hestitan, trying to be strong for her husband

Text.Value: Lily was our world. Knowing that she'll be able to put to rest properly makes things... easier. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: first time we see her a bit upset, overwhelmed with gratitude

Text.Value: Just dig a hole and dump the body - far cheaper.
Lily... we can't leave her like this.

EditorData.NodeContext: doesn't even see player - heart broken and grieving

Text.Value: Why don't you take a long walk off a short pier, yeah? Ignore her, love - she's just another arsehole.
Why don't you take a long walk off a short pier, yeah? Ignore him, love - he's just another arsehole.
Why don't you take a long walk off a short pier, yeah? Ignore them, love - they're just another arsehole.

EditorData.NodeContext: first line to player, second to husband

Text.Value: Thank you. I can't tell you how much it means this means to us - and to our little girl.

EditorData.NodeContext: overwhelmed with gratitude, voice breaking/upset at 'little girl'

Text.Value: He is? But why is he... why would you...

EditorData.NodeContext: confused, grateful but confused

Text.Value: A month? That seems a bit excessive.
Do. You. Mind?

EditorData.NodeContext: directed at player - angry at the interruption

Text.Value: Shh, love. We're going to get Lily a coffin, all right? Give her the burial she deserves.

EditorData.NodeContext: speaking to husband, trying to be strong

Text.Value: She said no questions, honey.
He said no questions, honey.
They said no questions, honey.

EditorData.NodeContext: a gentle smile for her husband

Text.Value: You lost your child? I'm so sorry.
Seven years of age and murdered. What kind of monster hurts a little girl?

EditorData.NodeContext: breaking down, sobbing at the end

Synopsis: The bereaved father and mother are heartbroken and grieving. Their little girl was murdered and they can't get her a coffin - the coffin maker is too backed up.
